channel.title: How to delete a door?
channel.description:
Hey, well after a long break from coding, I unfortunately forgot how to remove doors.
I've tried the deletethatobject, but it didn't work. *Sigh*
SO, I was wondering if you guys could help me, and if so that would be great.
Much appreciated, Jackson.

item.title: How to delete a door?
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“Ace., post:9, topic:332519”]Unfortunately, it didn’t work for me (talking to Ytuio9)
I got the 100 errors.

OWned_Pl0xs, would you be able to give me a simple and small tutorial as of where to add that in, what to edit/change, etc.

I’m giving Rep++ to whoever fixes this problem ;).[/quote]

                        
                          if(objectID == 1530) && (objectX == 2716 && objectY == 3472){
                          ReplaceObject(2716, 3472, 1530, -3, 0);
                         }

you probably missed/added a bracket…

Read full topic

item.title: How to delete a door?
item.dc:creator: @Owned_Pl0xs Owned_Pl0xs
item.description:
@Owned_Pl0xs wrote:

public void deleteDoor(int objectX, int objectY) { if(withinDistance(60, absX, absY, objectX, objectY)) { outStream.createFrame(85); outStream.writeByteC(objectY - (mapRegionY * 8)); outStream.writeByteC(objectX - (mapRegionX * 8)); outStream.createFrame(101); outStream.writeByteC(0); outStream.writeByte(0); } }

Read full topic

item.title: How to delete a door?
item.dc:creator: @raze9999 raze9999
item.description:
@raze9999 wrote:

go to Client. Java … press Ctrl +f ,search for Deletethatopject…
you will found like this
deletethatobject(2760, 3487);
select it and copy
under it prees ctrl+v or peast
and change the pos, to where you need to delete . thanks

Read full topic

why would you want to use deleteThatObject when you could just use replaceObject and make it look more professional by making the door actually open?
